meanings.definition: A brass musical instrument with a flared bell and a bright, penetrating tone.
meanings.sent1: The band played a trumpet at the concert.
meanings.sent2: She learned to play the trumpet in music class.
meanings.sent3: The trumpet blared, waking up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: His voice was a trumpet, commanding attention in the room.
meanings.sent5: The trumpet's shiny surface gleamed under the stage lights.

meanings.definition: To proclaim or announce loudly or widely.
meanings.sent1: The mayor will trumpet the new policy in his speech.
meanings.sent2: They trumpet their achievements to everyone they meet.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to trumpet its hunger by knocking over the food bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to trumpet through the entire building.
meanings.sent5: The news anchor's voice seemed to trumpet the urgency of the situation.

meanings.definition: A loud, clear sound made by or resembling that of a trumpet.
meanings.sent1: The trumpet of an elephant echoed through the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock's trumpet woke him up abruptly.
meanings.sent3: The trumpet of the swan startled the nearby ducks.
meanings.sent4: The trumpet of the train signaled its departure from the station.
meanings.sent5: The trumpet of the thunderstorm warned of an approaching downpour.

meanings.sent1: He will trumpet a tune at the school talent show.
meanings.sent2: She practiced every day to trumpet perfectly in the orchestra.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to trumpet along with the radio.
meanings.sent4: The musician's fingers moved swiftly to trumpet the melody.
meanings.sent5: She could trumpet beautifully, captivating the audience with her music.
